explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 4.2mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 2.11mg/kg (RTECS (2006)), 20mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)) and 28mg/kg (HSDB (2006)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 162mg/kg (RTECS (2006)) and 162mg/kg (HSDB (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the LC50 value of 0.144mg/L calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of dust/mist) of 0.144mg/L (4 hours) (RTECS (2006)), 0.2mg/L (4 hours) (IUCLID (2000)) and 0.3mg/L (4 hours) (HSDB (2006)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (4 hour application) (IUCLID (2000)): "Slightly irritating."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (IUCLID (2000)): "Slightly irritating."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: The substance could be "Not classified" based on the negative results obtained in a guinea pig Maximization test (IUCLID (2000)). However, classification is not possible with only one set of data available.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible based on expert judgment in the absence of existing classification, though some data are available on carcinogenicity studies with mice and rats.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of adverse effects on the offspring at doses inducing parental toxicity, described in IUCLID (2000).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "late progressive polyneuropathy followed by pyramidal findings in a 20-year old agricultural laborer who ingested Isofenphos solution during his work" (HSDB (2003)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies including "delayed neuropathy" (EHC 63 (1986)). The effects on humans are classified into Category 2 as the priority rating of the referenced studies is 2, whereas the effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (nervous system), and thus classified into Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "toxic signs, such as salivation and muscle twitching, were observed," "hypoplasia of the testis were observed in several males; some exhibited foci of softening ("degeneration processes") in the brain stem" (JMPR 552, 1982), "pathological lesions, such as severe degeneration of the pathways in the spinal cord and axonal degeneration in the medulla oblongata and cerebellum, which are typical of delayed neuropathy" (JMPR 744, 1986). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=1.6ppb of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.12 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
